quest.name: The Lominsan Envoy
journal: Merlwyb wishes to entrust you with an important task.

Appointing you her personal envoy, Merlwyb bids you deliver a missive to the other two leaders of the Eorzean Alliance. In order to facilitate your journey, she bestows upon you an airship pass, which will allow you to travel by air between the three allied nations. Before making your way to the airship landing, be sure to quiz Baderon as to what awaits beyond the Strait of Merlthor.

In addition to Limsa Lominsa, the Eorzean Alliance encompasses the city–states of Gridania and Ul'dah. Once you have made your final preparations for the journey, take the Crow's Lift to the airship landing and speak with L'nophlo at the entrance lobby.
You are now ready to embark upon the first leg of your journey, which will take you to Gridania. Make your way to the landing area and await departure.
Having safely arrived in Gridania, you must now seek an audience with the Elder Seedseer. Ask the serpent honor guard for assistance.
The Elder Seedseer awaits you at the Lotus Stand. Make your way to Nophica's Altar within Old Gridania, and present Merlwyb's missive to the silent conjurer to gain admission.

The Elder Seedseer is receptive to the proposal detailed in Merlwyb's missive. It appears the Garlean Empire remains a grave threat to Eorzea, with the XIVth Imperial Legion, led by Legatus Gaius van Baelsar, deeply entrenched in the border regions. Your business in Gridania successfully concluded, make your way to the airship landing and speak with Lionnellais.
You are now ready to embark upon the second leg of your journey, which will take you to Ul'dah. Make your way to the landing area and await departure.
Having safely arrived in Ul'dah, you must now seek an audience with the Flame General. Ask the flame honor guard for assistance.
The Flame General awaits you at the Royal Promenade. Present Merlwyb's missive to Bartholomew on the Hustings Strip to gain admission.

Having now passed on Merlwyb's message to the leaders of both Gridania and Ul'dah, you have discharged your duty as the Admiral's envoy, and learned of the various threats facing Eorzea in the process. Given the immensity of the forces at work, you are moved to wonder what meaningful contribution a lone adventurer might make to the realm's preservation. Perhaps the answer will be revealed to you in the days to come.
objectives: Speak with L'nophlo at the airship landing.
Speak with the serpent honor guard.
Present Merlwyb's missive to the silent conjurer at Nophica's Altar.
Speak with Lionnellais at the airship landing.
Speak with the flame honor guard.
Present Merlwyb's missive to Bartholomew on the Hustings Strip.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The duty I have in mind for you requires some explanation. I do hope you have not made other plans. To business, then.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I have penned a letter to each of my counterparts in the Eorzean Alliance.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The Battle of Carteneau and the Calamity that followed claimed countless lives.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: It has been five years since those of us who were spared dragged ourselves from the ashes to look upon an Eorzea we scarcely knew... Five years, and yet the people still suffer.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Their lives are fraught with worry and hardship, and the Warriors of Light who might once have given them hope are gone.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Yet we must press on regardless. We will never truly do so, however, till we have faced our past.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: To that end, I am proposing that a memorial service be held in each of the city–states on the fifth anniversary of the Battle of Carteneau.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: These letters contain the details of said proposal.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And I would have you deliver them to our allies as my personal envoy.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: You have proven yourself a staunch and able ally to Limsa, but that is not my only reason for choosing you. No. I choose you because you possess a quality which puts me in mind of history's champions. A quality I feared lost. Say that you will perform this duty.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I knew you would not disappoint me.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: This task shall take you far from the borders of our nation, to the city–states of Gridania and Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: A grueling journey, to be sure...were you to travel by sea and land. But I mean to have you take to the skies.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: An airship pass, to be used at your discretion.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Airships bound for the nations of our allies leave from the landing connected to the Bridge. But before you depart, I suggest you trouble Baderon for a few pearls of wisdom regarding each of your destinations. The old bastard is nothing if not well traveled.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: 'Tis a pity I cannot issue such passes with a freer hand, as I did in more peaceful times, when berths were not so limited. But in these times of war, every craft we commit to the clouds risks drawing the eye of the Empire, and every voyage must needs be born of necessity.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Lest you doubt, I consider your place well deserved.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Nor am I alone in that opinion. There were other parties who would see you granted the privilege of air travel.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Aye, Forename, your deeds do not go unnoticed.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Full many see great promise in you. But I have flattered you enough.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: On behalf of Limsa Lominsa and her people, I bid you go forth, adventurer.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Discover the realm for which so many have fought and died.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Wonder and danger await you in equal measure, but turn not from either. Only by braving the unknown will you achieve the greatness of which you are surely capable.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The light of the Crystal guides you, and I wager that your destiny will be no small thing.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Back from yer meetin' with the Admiral, are ye?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Personal bleedin' envoy!?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: So ye'll be carryin' the word o' the Admiral 'erself to the leaders o' the Alliance!?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Bugger me... I knew ye was goin' up in the world, but I didn't realize ye'd got that bloody 'igh!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: I'm proud o' ye, lasslad! Thinkin' of 'ow far ye've come...why, 'tis enough to bring a tear to me eye! An' that ain't the ale talkin', neither─well, not just the ale, at any rate...

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Bless the Navigator fer steerin' ye my way.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: 'Course, this is only the start! Now ye've got yer 'ands on an airship pass, the 'ole of Eorzea's laid out before ye, like a fair maid on a feather bed!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: An' she's a big girl, too, with plenty of enticin' nooks an' crannies!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: If ye think us Lominsans are characters, just wait till ye cross paths with the grim forest dwellers o' Gridania, or trade coins with the crafty merchants of Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: An' then there's the wild places where the beasties rule, an' no bugger with an onze o' sense sets foot...

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: But yer a 'venturer, so I wouldn't let a little thing like that 'old ye back.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: 'Course, it ain't all explorin' an' excitement.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: There's an 'eap o' troubles what plagues every nation, see─'tain't just ours. I'm talkin' intrigue an' infightin', beastmen an' their godsdamned primals─aye, there's an ugly side to life, an' sooner or later, yer bound to walk into it.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: ...But I'll wager there's bugger all out there as you can't 'andle. Summat tells me yer goin' to be just fine.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: The realm's 'ad it rough, 'tis true, but folk're beginnin' to recover from the beatin' the Calamity dealt 'em. Call me an 'opeless optimist, but it wouldn't take much to turn things 'round.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text:
'Tis the perfect time fer a 'venturer like yerself to get out there an' make a difference!
...Well, what are ye waitin' fer!?

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. This is the counter for passengers traveling to Gridania.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: ...Wait, aren't you that famous adventurer? It's Forename Surname, isn't it? I thought I recognized you! You are an inspiration to us all, madamsir! Highwind Skyways is at your disposal! Will you be traveling with us today?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Take your time, madamsir. I'll be glad to assist you when you're ready.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Are you ready to depart, madamsir? The airship bound for Gridania will be leaving shortly.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Thank you for using Highwind Skyways. The airship to Ul'dah will soon be departing.

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Take your time, madamsir. I'll be glad to assist you when you're ready.

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Do you wish to leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: We hope you have a pleasant voyage.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Board the airship?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: ANNOUNCE
dialogue.text: Attention, all passengers: the airship bound for Gridania is about to depart. Please make your way to the boarding gate.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Good fortune to ye, Forename.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: The day'll come when yer name means the same as “'ero” to the folk o' this realm.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: May ye walk in the light o' the Crystal...

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the envoy from Limsa Lominsa. Welcome to Gridania, madamsir. The Elder Seedseer awaits your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Please let me know if you require any assistance.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: Greetings, good madamsir.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: You are the Lominsan envoy, are you not? I have received instructions to assist you.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: Pray make your way into the city proper, and identify yourself to the conjurer at Nophica's Altar. She will admit you to the Lotus Stand, where the Elder Seedseer awaits.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: Pray make your way into the city proper, and identify yourself to the conjurer at Nophica's Altar. She will admit you to the Lotus Stand, where the Elder Seedseer awaits.

dialogue.name: DOORMANLOTUS
dialogue.text: You are the Lominsan envoy? Begging your pardons, madamsir, but might I inspect the missive you bear?

dialogue.name: DOORMANLOTUS
dialogue.text: Verily, this is the seal of the Admiral of Limsa Lominsa. Please come with me.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: So you are the Lominsan envoy.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: And an adventurer besides. The realm owes much to you and yours.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: On behalf of our fair nation, I bid you welcome.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Please.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce myself.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I am Kan-E-Senna, Elder Seedseer of Gridania, and leader of the Order of the Twin Adder, our nation's Grand Company.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I understand you bear a message from the Admiral.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: But...before you begin, might I behold your face more closely?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: My apologies. You put me in mind of one I once knew─a brave and noble soul.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: But come, let us return to the matter at hand.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: A remembrance service for the fallen of Carteneau...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: To think that five years have already come and gone...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: It seems like only yesterday that the Garlean Empire attempted to seize all that we hold dear.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Rising in resistance, the city–states of Eorzea formed the Grand Companies, and joined hands in alliance.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: But unbeknown to us, the Garleans sought not to best us in battle, but moved instead to enact a terrible plot: the Meteor project, by which the lesser moon, Dalamud, would be torn down from the heavens to annihilate all life below.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: In a desperate bid to save the realm from certain destruction, our forces marched for the Carteneau Flats, and there met the VIIth Imperial Legion.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: More bloody a battle I have never seen, and would never wish to see again. Yet the carnage was but a prelude to the atrocity which followed.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: For despite our best efforts, Dalamud continued its descent, and from it emerged the elder primal Bahamut, who proceeded to rain fire upon Eorzea.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The VIIth Imperial Legion was consumed in the blinking of an eye, while our own forces fared little better...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: That any among us were spared defies explanation. All seemed sure to perish.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: As the flames converged upon us, I prepared myself for death...only for a brilliant light to envelop me, relieving me of my senses.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: When at last I awoke, Bahamut was gone, and the land, which had but moments before been aflame, now seemed to me a place unknown─not simply ruined...but changed.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Archon Louisoix may well have been able to shed light upon these mysteries, but he, like so many, never returned from Carteneau.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: And so we were left with countless questions, and no prospect of an answer. Yet such matters did not long occupy our thoughts, for we had far graver concerns.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The Calamity, as the devastation wrought by Bahamut has come to be known, laid our nations nigh to waste, and to this day we struggle to rebuild our lives and homes.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: To compound matters, the beast tribes continue to summon their primals, while the Empire encroaches upon our borders, consolidating its foothold in Eorzea. The outlook, in short, is bleak.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: In the wake of the Calamity, it has been all each nation could do to nurse its own wounds.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Yet if we are to weather the coming storm, we must needs stand united once more. A remembrance service may well present an opportunity to rekindle the spirit of unity which first gave rise to the Alliance.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I wholeheartedly approve of the Admiral's proposal. The necessary provisions shall be made for a service here in Gridania.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: You have done the people of Eorzea a fine service this day, and I would not put you to further trouble. I shall see that my reply reaches the Admiral anon.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: You, meanwhile, are bound next for Ul'dah, are you not?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Please send the Flame General my regards. Ah, and if you would be so kind, I should appreciate it if you would inform him that a pet of mine has been ill behaved of late─my wolf, to be precise. Needless to say, he must be brought to heel, and I would very much welcome the General's counsel on how this might be achieved.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I thank you for coming. May the Twelve see you safe to Ul'dah and beyond.

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. This is the counter for passengers traveling to Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Oh, are you not Forename Surname, the Lominsan envoy? On behalf of all at Highwind Skyways, may I say what an honor it is to serve you! Will you be flying with us today?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Very well. When you are ready to board, please let me know.

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Do you wish to leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: Q8
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: We hope you have a pleasant voyage.

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: The flight for Ul'dah will soon be departing. Are your preparations in order, madamsir?

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Very well. When you are ready to travel, you need only say the word.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Board the airship?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the envoy from Limsa Lominsa! Welcome to Ul'dah, madamsir. The Flame General awaits your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Please let me know if you require any assistance.

dialogue.name: FLAMEA
dialogue.text: Welcome to Ul'dah, madamsir. We have been expecting you.

dialogue.name: FLAMEA
dialogue.text: Flame General Raubahn will receive you in the Fragrant Chamber. Please take the lift down to the Hustings Strip and speak with Bartholomew at the Royal Promenade.

dialogue.name: FLAMEA
dialogue.text: The lift over yonder will take you to the Hustings Strip. From there, proceed south to the Royal Promenade, and speak with Bartholomew to gain admittance to the Fragrant Chamber.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: The Lominsan envoy, I presume? Would you be so good as to allow me to inspect the missive you bear, madamsir? My thanks.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: Ah yes, the Admiral's seal. Please proceed.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, a guest from Limsa. I thought I smelled stale ale.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I won't hold it against you. If you're half the warrior Merlwyb says, 'tis a wonder you don't reek of dead Sahagin.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Welcome to the sultanate of Ul'dah. I am Raubahn Aldynn, General of the Immortal Flames.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But you did not come all this way to trade formalities.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: There's something familiar about you... For a moment, I mistook you for an old sister-in-armsbrother-in-arms.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Like herhim, you have the eyes of a hero. Eyes that have looked upon the horrors of battle, unblinking.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I've no doubt Merlwyb saw them, too. Mayhap there is hope for Limsa Lominsa yet! Come, let us talk.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...Carteneau. Aye, I remember bloody Carteneau.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Do you know what happened that day, adventurer? When we took the field against the Garleans?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: So my counterparts have educated you.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hm? Kan–E's pet is giving her trouble, is it? Well, she should already know my mind on that subject.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Wolves are beyond taming. 'Tis but a matter of time before they bare their teeth.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: So it was with the Garleans, fifty years ago.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: No sooner had they learned how to use magitek than they began seizing territory from their neighbors.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Led by then legatus Solus zos Galvus, they swiftly brought the other nations of Ilsabard to heel. And so the legatus became an emperor, and his republic an empire...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: An empire which then set its sights upon Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ROAILLE
dialogue.text: But the conquering emperor is now an old man of four score winters. His health is failing, and he has no clear successor. Like as not, this is why the Garleans have been quiet of late.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But the XIVth Imperial Legion is still entrenched within our borders.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And their commander, Legatus Gaius van Baelsar, has long harbored ambitions of conquest.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Were he to strike now, I fear we would fall like so many others before us. And not only Ul'dah, but Gridania and Limsa Lominsa as well.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: For the Calamity brought the lot of us to our knees, and we've yet to get up. We barely have the strength to stand against the beast tribes, never mind the primals they mean to summon.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We are a realm divided, adventurer. An alliance in name only.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But the wolf cares not for the plight of its prey.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The Garleans stir, and the Elder Seedseer would not let it go unnoticed.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: All other concerns pale in comparison to the Empire─even the beast tribes and their bloody primals.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We must stand united once more, that much is clear. And if we're to do so, we must remember the cause which last brought us together. Merlwyb will have her memorial.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We will honor the memory of the fallen. We will remind the people what their brothers and sisters fought and died for.

dialogue.name: ROAILLE
dialogue.text: Shall I inform the sultana and the Syndicate?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I will speak with Her Grace myself.

dialogue.name: ROAILLE
dialogue.text: Very good, sir.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The Admiral will have my reply anon.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: My thanks to you, adventurer.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can now make use of the airship routes connecting the three nations. Before you may board an airship, you must pay the requisite fare in gil.

dialogue.name: Q11
dialogue.text: Enter the command room?

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: No
